slug: /193
title: "This Week In React #193: State of React, Server Functions, next/form, useId, Astro, Meteor, Gluestack, React-Aria, Turbopack, Airbnb, Apollo, DRY, IDX, Bootsplash, Flash Calendar, CSS, ES, Poku..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 07-24-2024
---

segments.source_content: Astro has released Server Islands, and it looks like a pretty simple but compelling solution to rival with Next.js Partial Prerendering, on which Vercel also published a great article. There's also the Renaissance of Meteor to look forward to, React Aria releases, and a v2 of Gluestack-UI for Universal React Native devs.

translations.fr: Astro a publiÃ© les Server Islands, une solution simple mais convaincante pour rivaliser avec le Partial Prerendering de Next.js, sur lequel Vercel a Ã©galement publiÃ© un excellent article. On assiste aussi Ã  la renaissance de Meteor, des sorties de React Aria, et une v2 de Gluestack-UI pour les dÃ©veloppeurs React Native universels.
translations.en: Astro a publiÃ© Server Islands, une solution simple mais convaincante pour rivaliser avec le Partial Prerendering de Next.js, sur lequel Vercel a Ã©galement publiÃ© un excellent article. On note aussi la Renaissance de Meteor Ã  venir, des sorties de React Aria, et une v2 de Gluestack-UI pour les dÃ©veloppeurs Universal React Native.

segments.source_content: Data grids are complex components of web applications, but current solutions are inefficient, require a lot of maintenance, and perform poorly. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforms the landscape with two key features: retargetable rendering and reactive signal state.

translations.fr: Les grilles de donnÃ©es sont des composants complexes des applications web, mais les solutions actuelles sont inefficaces, nÃ©cessitent beaucoup de maintenance et offrent des performances mÃ©diocres. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforme le paysage avec deux fonctionnalitÃ©s clÃ©s : le rendu retargetable et l'Ã©tat rÃ©actif par signaux.
translations.en: Les grilles de donnÃ©es sont des composants complexes dans les applications web, mais les solutions actuelles sont inefficaces, nÃ©cessitent beaucoup de maintenance et ont des performances mÃ©diocres. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforme le paysage avec deux fonctionnalitÃ©s clÃ©s : le rendu retargetable et l'Ã©tat rÃ©actif par signaux.

segments.source_content: **Graphite Grid** separates grid state from view logic, allowing a single unified state model to support a variety of render targets, declaratively or imperatively. It includes a **DOM and Canvas** renderer, giving developers flexible, high-performance options ğŸš€.

translations.fr: **Graphite Grid** sÃ©pare l'Ã©tat de la grille de la logique d'affichage, permettant Ã  un seul modÃ¨le d'Ã©tat unifiÃ© de prendre en charge diverses cibles de rendu, de maniÃ¨re dÃ©clarative ou impÃ©rative. Il inclut un moteur de rendu **DOM et Canvas**, offrant aux dÃ©veloppeurs des options flexibles et performantes ğŸš€.

Il inclut un moteur de rendu **DOM et Canvas**, offrant aux dÃ©veloppeurs des options flexibles et hautes performances ğŸš€.

segments.source_content: Graphite Grid is declarative and consistent, leveraging state signals to ensure seamless integration with your application. Designed with **React in mind**, it is the only JavaScript data grid built with React's state management primitives. [Try it now!](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)

translations.fr: Graphite Grid est dÃ©claratif et cohÃ©rent, exploitant les signaux d'Ã©tat pour garantir une intÃ©gration transparente avec votre application. ConÃ§u **pensÃ© pour React**, c'est la seule grille de donnÃ©es JavaScript construite avec les primitives de gestion d'Ã©tat de React. [Essayez-la dÃ¨s maintenant !](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)
translations.en: Graphite Grid est dÃ©claratif et cohÃ©rent, exploitant les signaux d'Ã©tat pour garantir une intÃ©gration transparente avec votre application. ConÃ§u pour **React**, c'est la seule grille de donnÃ©es JavaScript construite avec les primitives de gestion d'Ã©tat de React. [Essayez-le maintenant !](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)

segments.source_content: [![State of React 2023 - Survey Results](/emails/issues/193/stateofreact.jpg)](https://2023.stateofreact.com/en-US)

translations.en: [![State of React 2023 - RÃ©sultats de l'enquÃªte](/emails/issues/193/stateofreact.jpg)](https://2023.stateofreact.com/en-US)

segments.source_content: **[State of React 2023 - Survey Results](https://2023.stateofreact.com/)**

translations.en: **[State of React 2023 - RÃ©sultats de l'enquÃªte](https://2023.stateofreact.com/)**

segments.source_content: The very first State of React survey results are finally online. The data was collected in November 2023, and it took a while for the results to be published. It's a great tool for analyzing the trends in our beloved framework ecosystem. And it will become even better next year to see how those trends evolve. Without further ado, here are my picks:

translations.fr: Les tout premiers rÃ©sultats de l'enquÃªte State of React sont enfin en ligne. Les donnÃ©es ont Ã©tÃ© collectÃ©es en novembre 2023, et leur publication a pris un certain temps. C'est un excellent outil pour analyser les tendances dans l'Ã©cosystÃ¨me de notre framework prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©. Et cela deviendra encore plus intÃ©ressant l'annÃ©e prochaine pour voir comment ces tendances Ã©voluent. Sans plus attendre, voici mes sÃ©lections :
translations.en: Les tout premiers rÃ©sultats de l'enquÃªte State of React sont enfin en ligne. Les donnÃ©es ont Ã©tÃ© collectÃ©es en novembre 2023, et il a fallu un certain temps pour publier les rÃ©sultats. C'est un excellent outil pour analyser les tendances dans notre Ã©cosystÃ¨me de frameworks prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©. Et ce sera encore mieux l'annÃ©e prochaine pour voir comment ces tendances Ã©voluent. Sans plus attendre, voici mes choix :

segments.source_content:
- [The adoption of hooks has been largely successful](https://x.com/JoshWComeau/status/1814292932461306239)
- Very positive signals for React Query, Zustand, Radix UI, React Aria, shadcn/ui, tRPC, Zod
- No clear React framework winner. Next.js is the most popular but has slightly lower retention than Astro and Remix
- React renderer usage shows that React is not only React-DOM. More than 30% use React Native, and 9% use React-Three-Fiber.
- Only 7% have ever used [my favorite underrated hook useSyncExternalStore](https://thisweekinreact.com/articles/useSyncExternalStore-the-underrated-react-api)
- This Week In React is the 5th most popular resource in the "Blogs & Magazines" category (â¤ï¸ï¸ thanks!)

translations.fr:
- [L'adoption des hooks a Ã©tÃ© largement rÃ©ussie](https://x.com/JoshWComeau/status/1814292932461306239)
- Signaux trÃ¨s positifs pour React Query, Zustand, Radix UI, React Aria, shadcn/ui, tRPC, Zod
- Pas de vainqueur clair parmi les frameworks React. Next.js est le plus populaire mais a une rÃ©tention lÃ©gÃ¨rement infÃ©rieure Ã  Astro et Remix
- L'utilisation des moteurs de rendu React montre que React n'est pas seulement React-DOM. Plus de 30% utilisent React Native, et 9% utilisent React-Three-Fiber.
- Seulement 7% ont dÃ©jÃ  utilisÃ© [mon hook sous-estimÃ© prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© useSyncExternalStore](https://thisweekinreact.com/articles/useSyncExternalStore-the-underrated-react-api)
- This Week In React est la 5e ressource la plus populaire dans la catÃ©gorie "Blogs & Magazines" (â¤ï¸ï¸ merci !)
translations.en:
- [L'adoption des hooks a Ã©tÃ© un franc succÃ¨s](https://x.com/JoshWComeau/status/1814292932461306239)
- Signaux trÃ¨s positifs pour React Query, Zustand, Radix UI, React Aria, shadcn/ui, tRPC, Zod
- Pas de gagnant clair parmi les frameworks React. Next.js est le plus populaire mais a une rÃ©tention lÃ©gÃ¨rement infÃ©rieure Ã  Astro et Remix
- L'utilisation des moteurs de rendu React montre que React n'est pas seulement React-DOM. Plus de 30% utilisent React Native, et 9% utilisent React-Three-Fiber.
- Seulement 7% ont dÃ©jÃ  utilisÃ© [mon hook sous-estimÃ© prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© : useSyncExternalStore](https://thisweekinreact.com/articles/useSyncExternalStore-the-underrated-react-api)
- This Week In React est la 5Ã¨me ressource la plus populaire dans la catÃ©gorie "Blogs & Magazines" (â¤ï¸ï¸ merci !)

segments.source_content: The next State of React 2024 survey is [planned for September 2024](https://dev.to/sachagreif/planning-out-the-2024-state-of-surveys-4lb9) and now is the time to get involved in the survey design.

translations.fr: La prochaine enquÃªte State of React 2024 est [prÃ©vue pour septembre 2024](https://dev.to/sachagreif/planning-out-the-2024-state-of-surveys-4lb9) et c'est le moment de s'impliquer dans la conception de l'enquÃªte.
translations.en: Le prochain sondage State of React 2024 est [prÃ©vu pour septembre 2024](https://dev.to/sachagreif/planning-out-the-2024-state-of-surveys-4lb9) et c'est le moment de participer Ã  sa conception.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Reactile â€“ a new approach to React-based web apps. Create your own views. Let it handle your windows and widgets in a single browser tab](https://www.reactile.net/?utm_source=reactnewsletter)
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR - next/form](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/68102)
- ğŸ—“ï¸ [React-Brussels](https://www.react.brussels/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ª Brussels - 18 October - Some speakers have already been revealed ! Check out now, and apply 10% discount with code â€œTWIRâ€.
- ğŸ“œ [Data Fetching with Server Actions in Next.js](https://www.robinwieruch.de/next-server-actions-fetch-data/): You can use Server Actions to fetch client data using React-Query. There are limitations to consider though: they use POST requests and run sequentially. FYI a "use server" function called outside a transition is not a Server Action, but a [Server Function](https://x.com/sebastienlorber/status/1816096442492051672).
- ğŸ“œ [Use useId() Instead Of Hand-Making IDs](https://reacttraining.com/blog/use-useid-instead-of-hand-making-ids): IDs are useful for accessibility, but youâ€™d rather avoid creating them manually if you want to mount a component twice, or have good support for React hydration. To access DOM elements, `useRef` is enough.
- ğŸ“œ [Do not pass DTOs to UI components](https://darios.blog/posts/do-not-pass-dtos-to-ui-components): Explain why youâ€™d rather design component props shapes independently, instead of blindly using your backend payloads as props.
- ğŸ“œ [DRY â€“ the common source of bad abstractions](https://swizec.com/blog/dry-the-common-source-of-bad-abstractions/): Greatly illustrates how React devs could end up creating the wrong abstractions. React UI libraries learned over the years to not over-abstract and give you great flexibility through composition.
- ğŸ“œ [Turbopack updates: Moving homes](https://vercel.com/blog/turbopack-moving-homes): The Turbopack bundler is moving to the Next.js repository. Co-location will help the team iterate faster on production builds (currently 92%-ready!). Turbopack will remain a framework-agnostic standalone bundler: once ready, it will be moved back to a separate repository.
- ğŸ“œ [Vercel - How to choose the best rendering strategy for your app](https://vercel.com/blog/how-to-choose-the-best-rendering-strategy-for-your-app): Great overview of all the rendering strategies (SSG, SSR, ISR, CSR), their tradeoffs, and best practices. Using Partial Pre-Rendering builds on top of the strategies above. Using Next.js with Server Components and Suspense boundaries makes your app future-proof for selecting the best rendering strategy for each component.
- ğŸ“œ [How Airbnb Smoothly Upgrades React](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/how-airbnb-smoothly-upgrades-react-b1d772a565fd): Airbnb recently upgraded their frontends from React 16 to React 18. Using a â€œReact Upgrade Systemâ€, relying on shared infrastructure code and an incremental migration and rollout strategy.
- ğŸ“œ [Fine-grained Markdown](https://v1.codehike.org/blog/fine-grained-markdown): Interactive article from the creator of Code Hike (based on MDX) showing how we can decorate Markdown and extend it in a typesafe way to make it a richer medium.
- ğŸ“œ [Data fetching in useEffect vs Remix loader](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/use-effect-fetching)
- ğŸ“œ [Integrating Next.js with New Relic](https://www.thisdot.co/blog/integrating-next-js-with-new-relic)
- ğŸ“œ [Clean(er) React Architecture (Part 8) - How Does React-Query Fit Into The Picture?](https://profy.dev/article/react-architecture-tanstack-query)
- ğŸ“œ [Zoom - Why we chose T3 stack to build our reference apps on Web](https://developers.zoom.us/blog/why-we-chose-to-build-with-the-t3-stack/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Astro 4.12 - Server Islands](https://astro.build/blog/astro-4120/): Astro released a great new Server Islands feature that renders a placeholder on the server, and replaces it independently with dynamic content afterward, enabling you to render the rest of your site statically. This is an alternative approach to the Next.js model, planning to solve this with React Server Components + Suspense + Partial Pre-Rendering. Their demo is a rebranded fork of the Next.js PPR one and outperforms it!
- ğŸ“¦ [Meteor.js 3.0](https://forums.meteor.com/t/its-official-meteor-3-0-official-release-is-out/61860): Meteor just released a new major version that drops the legacy Fibers coroutines in favor of async/await, upgrade to Node 20 and integrates Express. This new version claims to be [Renaissance of Meteor.js](http://meteor.js), with launch events starting on July 29th. Iâ€™ve never used Meteor, and curious to know what place it will take alongside the modern React frameworks we have today.
- ğŸ“¦ [React Aria July 22 release - React 19 ready, virtualization improvements, toast focus management improvements, Color Picker RC](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2024-07-22.html)
- ğŸ“¦ [Apollo Client 3.11 - Subscription improvements, React 19 + compiler support, new testing library, new Devtools options](https://www.apollographql.com/blog/whats-new-in-apollo-client-3-11)
- ğŸ“¦ [eslint-plugin-use-server - Disallows top level "use server"](https://github.com/c-ehrlich/eslint-plugin-use-server)
- ğŸ§©ï¸ [Design GUI - Browser Extension for managing colors in CSS Variables - Support for shadcn/ui](https://www.designgui.io/)
- ğŸ¥ [React Summit 2024 - All the talks are online](https://portal.gitnation.org/events/react-summit-2024)
- ğŸ¥ [dotJS 2024 - YouTube playlist with talks from Malte Ubl, Mark Dalgleish and more](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9tx-dE8oBTY&list=PLMW8Xq7bXrG7fOUOLJQw9I7ygJCbue9zO)
- ğŸ¥ [Sam Selikoff - How to build a Recursive React Component](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6UU2Ey4KZr8)
- ğŸ¥ [Web Dev Simplified - How To Debug React Apps Like A Senior Developer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l8knG0BPr-o)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [Why you should use Redux in 2024 with Mark Erikson](https://podrocket.logrocket.com/redux-2024-mark-erikson)

segments.source_content: Not everyone uses Next.js â€” but it sure feels like itâ€™s the only JavaScript framework that gets first-class integrations. AuthKit, powered by WorkOS, is an open source authentication UI built with Radix components.

segments.source_content: Here's a [tutorial that shows you how to set up **AuthKit with any JS framework**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=237vaK_nYRg) in 30 minutes.

segments.source_content: **[Gluestack-UI v2 - Universal copy/paste components for Expo/Next](https://gluestack.io/)**

translations.fr: **[Gluestack-UI v2 - Composants universels copier/coller pour Expo/Next](https://gluestack.io/)**
translations.en: **[Gluestack-UI v2 - Composants universels Ã  copier-coller pour Expo/Next](https://gluestack.io/)**

segments.source_content: Gluestack-UI offers universal components and patterns for React, Next.js & React Native to copy & paste. The recently released v2 is a major update that focuses on performance optimization, reduced dependencies, and RSC compatibility. Itâ€™s based on Tailwind CSS (for web) and NativeWind (for native). Due to its copy & paste approach, upgrading is not as easy as bumping a dependency, but they have a straightforward tutorial and a code mod to help with the upgrade. To give you a glimpse of v2, they even released a little ğŸ¦ [trailer on X](https://x.com/gluestack/status/1813895494005112859).

translations.fr: Gluestack-UI propose des composants et des modÃ¨les universels pour React, Next.js et React Native Ã  copier-coller. La version v2 rÃ©cemment publiÃ©e est une mise Ã  jour majeure qui se concentre sur l'optimisation des performances, la rÃ©duction des dÃ©pendances et la compatibilitÃ© RSC. Elle est basÃ©e sur Tailwind CSS (pour le web) et NativeWind (pour le natif). En raison de son approche copier-coller, la mise Ã  niveau n'est pas aussi simple que d'incrÃ©menter une dÃ©pendance, mais ils proposent un tutoriel simple et un modificateur de code pour faciliter la mise Ã  niveau. Pour vous donner un aperÃ§u de la v2, ils ont mÃªme publiÃ© une petite ğŸ¦ [bande-annonce sur X](https://x.com/gluestack/status/1813895494005112859).
